name: 1-fluoropentane
Reason: 1-fluoropentane has a single fluorine atom attached to a pentane chain. The basic unit, pentane, has a melting point of -129.7 °C. Fluorine substituents significantly increase the melting point due to strong electronegativity which leads to stronger intermolecular dipole-dipole interactions. Each fluorine is estimated to increase the melting point by approximately 15 degrees Celsius, giving a total increase of (15 degrees Celsius x 1 fluorine) = 15 degrees Celsius.
